content:
Hi everyone! My name is Little J, and I'm in first grade. Today, I want to talk to you all about a very special woman named Michelle Obama. She was born in Chicago, Illinois and grew up to become one of the most important people in our country.

When Michelle was a little girl, she loved to read and play with her friends. She was always very smart, and her parents encouraged her to work hard and do her best. Michelle went to a good school, and she was very good at sports too! She was a basketball player and ran track.

When Michelle grew up, she became a lawyer and worked for a big company. She met a man named Barack Obama, and they fell in love and got married. They had two daughters, Malia and Sasha. Michelle was a great mom and helped her husband when he became the President of the United States.

Michelle is most famous for being the First Lady of the United States. She traveled all around the country and the world, speaking to people and helping them. She also wrote a book about her life and encouraged people to exercise and eat healthy food. She wants everyone to be their best selves and live happy, healthy lives.

Michelle is such a special person, and I'm so lucky to have learned about her. I hope that when I grow up, I can be like her and make a difference in the world. Thank you for listening to my speech about Michelle Obama!
